windup:xpath-value.description: Action : remove TestMessageStore

windup:hints.windup:regex-hint:
TestMessageStore is a out-of-the-box ESB action that is used in JBoss AS container tests to store a message with some form of logging - to a file, JMX, etc. TestMessageStore is used throughou the JBoss ESB sample projects to help test the results of processed messages.

windup:java-hints.windup:java-hint: Action classes in SOA 5 are simply CDI Beans in SOA 6. The extension of AbstractionActionLifecycle is no longer necessary. An action class can become a standalone service in SOA 6 or it can be invoked as a bean from a Camel route. For additional information and tips, see the action class microsite.

Access to the SwitchYard Message instance is no longer required in SOA 6 to access message content for a service invocation. If you are converting this action class to a CDI bean to be invoked from Camel, you can use the org.apache.camel.Message interface in place of org.jboss.soa.esb.message.Message. For additional information and tips, see the message access microsite.

ConfigTree is no longer used in SOA 6. If you have an action class that requires external configuration, convert the action class to a Bean Service in SOA 6 and use component properties to configure your Bean Service implementation.
